intro: Cestrum schiedei, commonly known as the pink cestrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds.
